reviewText: The game itself is great. There are pretty nice encounters and dungeons with fine voice acting that i liked. Bosses are fun to kill and PvP is also enjoyable.. Shooting MMO is something kinda new and this one is from the better ones... BUT... The loot policy in this game is TOTALY wrong. Imagine 10 hours raid in WoW with nothing but green drops. Yes, thats Firefall. They try to slow down players progression that much, that is unacceptable. The fact that shooting game isn't for relaxing (like WoW mainly is), it makes raiding more fun, but you also feel more tired after an hour raid for example... And if you find totaly nothing (No DKP / token system) from that raid.. i really mean NOTHING.. you are pretty disappointed and you feel like you wasted your hour. Every single patch they do follows this loot policy... like a week ago they added a new patch with new dungeon. It was fun to play, again.. i enjoyed it. The dungeon run took me around 40 minutes with other players and guess what i got from the last boss as only reward? Green item. Thats it, 40 minutes wasted, i don't want to do that again.\n\nRaid timers reset at wednesday, people usually login just to do time-locked raids (where you have like 10% to get 1 purple item, which is the biggest chance you get in this game) but today, there was like 10 people wanting to raid in the whole EU server. After the last patch, where devs promised changes to loot system" but players still got screwed
date: most of them just left the game...\n\nThe game is dead
recommended: no playerbase and im leaving too. Great game killed by series of bad decisions and horrible loot system."

reviewText:
I'm giving this game a qualified recommendation (read full review for clarification) that could just as well be a not recommended rating given how you look at my review.

The game as it exists now is pretty good and you're not likely to find any other MMORPG shooter that has character build diversity in the form of Battle Frames instead of classes that this one has.  There was a lack of content at launch for the Americas and Europe but they've added a lot of content since then.  As a free to play game I can safely recommend it but I should note several caveats in doing so.

This is really still a game in beta development at this point despite the fact that it was launched as finished product in the Americas and Europe.  This is pretty much undeniable as they have already gone through several small iterations of changes in core game mechanics such as the perk system, the module system used to customize player gear, an overhaul of the crafting system and changes in group loot distribution mechanics.

The real launch is probably going to be the launch of the game in China at which point they are going to implement a gigantic block of changes that are going to substantively change core game mechanics such as weapon characteristics such as rate of fire, recoil and unique characteristics for some such as overheating for the Plasma Canon for the Assault Battle Frames, removal of a core aspect of the modules (power rating which scales damage up), and a complete redesign of the crafting system, scaling of mob damage and many other things.

What this means is that the game you are going to be playing if you choose to play this game now instead of waiting until the end of the year will not be what the game is going to be with the China launch.  That also means that your gear will most likely be devalued with those changes which some players may want to avoid because that is a significant loss of investment of a player's time.  There has already been mention of item migration (the exchange of current in game items for new ones) for the crafting system but historically item migration in this game has meant inventory nerf.

Therefore while I can recommend the game to play as a free to play game, I cannot recommend you invest any actual money in this game until there is a clear vision of what the game is after the China launch and, if you believe you would be frustrated seeing all or many of the fruits of your in game labor getting nerfed, I would advise you to hold off playing the game until then as well.

One final note, the state of PvP in this game is pretty bad and probably as low as you're likely to find in any game.  The PvP comprises of duels and open world pvp in a region called Broken Peninsula, but the open world PvP has been shut down by the devs as a failure even though players can still engage in PvP there without the rewards system.  Arena PvP is going to be part of the China release version but currently no one has any idea what that will be like.

reviewText:
I´ve been playing this game quite a few month now, since I bought a founder pack in the very beginnig.

And I must say its the best MMO in a long time. Even so they changed alot in the process and you gotta start over a couple of times, I´m quite satisfied with the state its in right now.

Its rare in any MMO for having so much opportunities. All the Battleframes for example. Even if you dont wanna spend any money on the game you got 5 frames to start with and once you leveld em up you can unlock even more frames.

And if you get bored by one frame (which doesnt happen if you choose the right one for you), you can just switch to another frame.

You got alot of quests, missions, weapons, skills, areas and pvp just to name a few things.

The game takes quite some time to explore and find all the features in the game, but seriously who wants to finish an MMO in one week? :)

You dont even have to spend money to level up faster, coz with a group you´re allways leveling up no matter if you got the xp boost or not.

All the new missions are fun too and the worldmap is alot bigger then in the beginning. The game isnt as complex anymore with all the diffrent resources gone, which some people like and some hate, but its easier to understand if you´re new to the game.

So all in all the game is awesome and was definitely worth the 100$ for the founders pack and I´m spending another 100$ for the Digital Deluxe Edition coz in my opinion I had alot of fun in this game and will have in the future:)

Try it out, if you like it support the game^^

reviewText:
JAN 2016 update:
So after a year of no updates, they have completely changed the game again. Up until December 2015 it was actually looking promising. Then they decided to ♥♥♥♥ up everything again, because apparently the devs can't go more than 6 months without changing everything. They removed all the weapon alt-fire modes just to slap on ADS on everything and turned down the run speed so the game is slow as hell. All the passive perks that made the frames different were removed because they were too confusing? What the ♥♥♥♥ Red 5?



Firefall was a promising massive open world shooter with arena PvP, now it is just a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ crafting/economy based MMORPG with no PvP. Another game killed by its developers. It seems they fixed most of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t! No more gear breaking permanently, crafting and resources have been simplified, and although it not Arena PvP there is Open World PvP in the game now.

Biggest issue right now that I see is inventory slots. I had 700+ items in my inventory since the last time I played last summer/fall. The item cap is at 155, so the first hour or so I was just salvaging junk to get under the cap so my character could move, and I spent all the Red Beans (ingame currency) I had left on buying item slots to get up to 235. Having the cap start at 200 and go up by 25 at same prices would be better.

reviewText:
This game failed to keep me interested. The initial story cutscene was alright, but after that I was thrust into a world where I had no idea what I was doing. Mind, I was using a controller... but any other shooter game where I've connected a controller, console or otherwise, the controls have all been the same. Firefall completely changed the majority of those controls, and I had no idea what I was doing half the time.

On top of that, I didn't even need to do anything. In the first mission, I was just standing at the spawn point trying to figure out the options menu while everyone else murdered all the NPC enemies. I closed the options menu when I heard that the first objective had been cleared, because I wanted to actually contribute. But I felt like I wasn't; there were no less than 20 people shooting with me, so it felt like anything I was doing was pointless.

Yes, this is a biased review because I played Destiny just a couple of weeks ago. I'm buying Destiny and deleting Firefall. I would suggest the same for everyone else.

reviewText: This Game Is Really Not Half Bad, But It Has A Lot Of Things That Could Have Been Better. Most Of The World Events Are The Same Like Crashed Thumpers And Crashed LGV Which Are The Most Common. The Best Time For World Events Is When The Servers Come Back Online After A Update. You Will Find Your Self Running Back And Forth A Lot To Job Bords. A Lot Of Grinding Is Involved. Having Friends That Play The Game Makes It A Little Better Due To The Fact That Mobs Spawn Depends On How Many Players Are Withtin The Area. It Is A Little Difficult To Play Alone Unless You Can Heal Quite Often Or You Have An Oustanding Amount Of Hp. Thumping Can Get Out Of Hand Like When I Was Attack By Four Chosen Drop Pods And Over 20 Chosen Appared. You Start With The Basic Warframes And Can level Them To Level 40 By That Time You Can Get An Advanced Warframe Which Is A Little Diffren From The Basic. You Do Not Have To Get A Advanced Warframe Form The Same Class Set You Can Get A Warframe Form The Other Set. For Example If You Get And Recon To 40 You Can Get An Advance Enginer Warframe Insead Of An Advance Recon Warframe Due to The Fact You Only Earn Pilot Credits To Unlock Frames. Walking is Pretty Slow And The Map Is Pretty Big So It Will Take Some Time To Walk From One Side Of The Map To The Other Unless You Take The Ships From Town To Town. The World Map Is Bigger Than Just The Area You Start In. if You Scroll Out You Will Find That Thier Are Other Areas Other Than Just That One Location Free Of The Melding. The Ingame Curancy Can Be Exchanged For Red Beans Which Is The Cash Shop Curancy. Thier Are Still  Bugs But Its Playable. The Ui Is Pretty Confusin It Was Better Before They Updated It In My Opinion. You Can't Change The Color Of Your Wepons. To Be Honest I Like The Game But It Will Take More Content Or A Crew Or Friends Before I Become An Active Player.

reviewText:
First off I would like to say that I really think that there should be a middle ground between the thumbs up and thumbs down. My personal opinion on this game is pretty neutral. As for why I put a thumbs down on this review it felt like right thing to do at the time. Alrighty then, here is my review.

Okay, before anyone says anything about the steam timestamp I want to say that I had been playing Firefall since the closed beta had really kicked off at some point just after 2010. The game is fun for if you want to go kill things and the visuals are good. I even put many many hours into the game. However, even though it has a certain amount of good things going for it there are a certain amount of things that happened to make me feel like I won't reccommend it. Am I being unreasonable? Maybe. I know it's just a game, and the developers can do whatever the like with it. But to be honest, I guess it's more about how dissapointed I am with where the game has gone since I started playing it.

First off, to understand where I am coming from I need to say some things about the beta and how the game had really changed from the initial designs when the game first started out.

Starting out, I thought the game had just about everything going for it. You had the different kinds of battleframes which you could switch back and forth from with no penalty costs, the begining tutorial was pretty good in introducing you to the idea of having to kill the bugs and the chosen, and in getting you to try and collect the resources by thumping". They even had a pretty fun setup for doing team matches and deathmatches.

After a while a new update came out and took out the medic battleframe and changed it into the Biotech. It really affected some of the playstyles that you had come up with at that point. Which was okay since it was something different and it just took a bit of getting used to.

Later on
date: there was another update that added assault fights with the chosen and those were fun to. They even upgraded the battleframe system too and it looked cool and was fun to use.\n\nBut
recommended: then things started to change when the Founders packs showed up and the Bean market started. When I first heard of it I thought that it could be cool
hoursPlayed: but when it was enabled it wasn't anything like I thought it would be. Starting out
voteText: the prices were pretty outragous. While the first tier of the the founders pack was around the price of a new game and would have been okay the higher ones were kinda rediculous. But even worse was the Bean market and it's prices. I remember that one pair of cosmetic goggles was like $5 and higher. While I understand that since the game is free to play they needed money to keep it going it was just like "Wow
helpfulPercent: are they kidding me?". I put up with it because for me the rest of the game was still fun to play at that point and things could change.\n\nChange they did. After a number of months after being inactive because of being busy
votesHelpful: I logged back in just before the game came out on steam. The tutorial is completely different and even parts of the map are different. The Bean costs are still way too high and I don't think its right to charge people that much for cosmetics
votesTotal: especially since from what I can tell it is pretty hard to earn beans in game.The parts that bugged me the most though is how the Battleframe system has changed
votesFunny:
and how it penalizes you with a cost for if you want to change your class.

I don't know what happened to make them end up putting those changes in the game but it kind've ruined the experience that I had with them.

I personally say that you should download it and try it for yourself to determine what you think about it. You can't always solely rely just on other people's reviews to determine if you will like a game or not."

reviewText: When i heard about FireFall being like a spiritual successor to the tribes franchise, i thought that this game was gonna kickass for its cool looking armor designs, and open world MMO. well i did played the game, but the payoff was pretty cheap. the framerate is pretty poor, even if i lowered the video quality, there's like tons of main missions it wants me to do that contributes nothing, and the even though it may have a lot of potential for a epic Sci-fi adventure, it ends up feeling like a generic one at best. i encountered some random pauses thinking that the game crashed for like 30 seconds, when it only paused for certain reasons i don't know. if only there was an MMO where you can play as the aliens, with a complex backstory. weather being a peaceful race, or a aggressive one fighting with and against the humans, it could have been great. but this type of game seeing how i anticipated it for a while, it was a fierce dissapointment. and as far as being a free to play MMO, i can't denie that it may include items that you need to pay real money in order to get some. I really don't recommand it if your into FPS's or MMOS.

reviewText: Game had the potential to be pretty cool. Graphics are pretty, combat can be fun ( has some big firefights), classes have different cool abilities. However, it lacks a lot of things to do in game. You pretty much just go back and forth from job boards doing essentially the same thing: killing either bandits or monsters, and/or collecting crap. Thats it. Scenery hardly changes so you really start to get tired of looking at the same jungles and swamps and crap by level 20. Customization is essentially crap, no skill trees or anything to make your dreadnought different from other ones. Most the basic cosmetic customization costs money, and theres no customization for armor besides paint, so you'll look the same from level 1 to 40 unless you want to pay to change your color a few times. I'd skip this one, it looks and sounds cool but gets boring after a week or so.

reviewText:
There are games worse than Firefall, but the only reason it is there is because it has no competition.

It was not always like this. Beta Firefall was an alright game, with its flaws but also its charm. The original contraint system and the crafting meant there was an actual open world, fully explorable from start to finish, no level gating. Thumping was fun, and even a player in stock gear could be useful for more powerful enemies.

And since launch, you can feel the call of money. The game is not even pay to win, because there are very few worthwhile items in the store and every single one is overpriced. The game progression went to the usual boring level system which locks content out for new players and makes 80% of the world useless for higher level ones. Crafting is now as stereotypical as it could get, and half of the materials are useless. There is no content to back up the game either, 2 raid bosses with pitiful  rewards (3 items at most for 20 people) on a SEVEN day cooldown, all missions are the same, and the grind is omnipresent. Gear customization is also extremely limited and the Power rating system is easy to undestand but extremely limited.

Visually, the game has a rather basic art style, which has a nice render, and the soundtrack is amazing, however, the technical side is awful, bugs are everywhere and the optimization is non-existent which make the game lag horribly when the action is clogged.

And let's not talk about PvP that is borderline broken, be it for playing (You can't even enter it unless you make your way around it and even then it is very slow and painful - also this bug was supposed to be fixed in the most recent patch but is not) or class balance, which is... inexistant.

Good points :
- Graphics style
- Soundtrack
- Combat is fun

Bad points :
- Bugs everywhere
- Painful grind
- Endgame is almost inexistant
- PvP broken
- Has actually devolved
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I was on the beta of this game, had high hopes about it. Bit of the same hopes I had with Defiance.

But it is the same kind of disappointment.

Don't get me wrong : if you like endless and mindless grinding, graphics coming straight from 5 years ago in a game having a hard time being stable (those freezes, man...), a chat window full with Cyrillic, you'll love FireFall.

If you're searching for a good shooter with nice mechanics and non stop action, please do turn back. You'll be running and/or Jetpacking a good 70% of the time here. Vehicles are mostly 1 time uses (because when you don't need you bike anymore, make it explode), if you don't have credits.

This leads me to the economic system of the game. Minerals/Metals, Research Points, Crystite, Recycling products, Time (yes, time is kind of something you have to take in account while crafting), Credits, Red Beans... There is way too much currencies in this game. You'll spend a huge amount of time acquiring said resources, for a very, very small reward. While leveling I had this issue more than once : I research a crafting recipe (needs : Time, Crystite, Research), once it's researched I need to go farm some recyclables, crystite and ore. Then I need to craft (Time & Metals) the components for my final recipe. Then I craft my recipe. Aaaaand it's 2 levels below me now, a green loot would render all this farming useless.

Although there are some good points in this game too, mainly the fact that you can unlock any BattleFrame (= Classes) when you level one at the maximum level, this does not outweight the bad.

By the way, I would have recommended this game before. So if you want to test it, level up to, say, 15, you'll probably have a  nice time. But do not expect this to last, it WILL get boring.

reviewText:
tl;dr: The bad parts of an MMORPG are present, but they are outweighed by the positives of an FPS and addicting gameplay, in my opinion at least. It deserves a try, at least. 7 out of 10, I had fun with it.

Firefall is basically what you get if you take Planetside and Guild Wars 2, then stick them in a blender and hope for the best.

The game is an F2P, MMO, FPS in which everything goes to hell all at once and now you, the player, must go around in power armor with a jetpack fixing problems and blowing up aliens/bandits/giant bugs.

The game itself has MMORPG styled objectives for missions, which is somewhat of a bad thing, because it usually is just Go here and shoot a specified number of enemies". The gameplay is fairly fun
recommended: but other people may not. Its free

reviewText:
I would not recommend this Game if you are looking for Fun.

This Game is a mess. I had a hard time not trying not to run in Bugs .. most annyoing Bug is the messed up Terrain which makes you fall through the Ground and getting stuck in the Ground.

The Classes are not balanced. I played mainly with a Recon, but since some Jobs are just way too hard with a Class who go no Armor i focused on Thumping (Mining for Ressources while defending) and picking up crashed Thumper/Bikes.

Sometimes there are Chosen spawning attacking something .. if that happens, rush there cause you kill 1 or 2 and get a ton of xp (~30k xp in 2min) .. too easy.

Mainly you play solo (if you got no friends who play with you) cause the Chat is dead.
The Pilot Tokens you need to unlock a new Frame (Sub Class) are avaiable as soon as you reach lv 40, otherwise u need to invest around 12$ each frame.

If this Game gets rereleased in the next 2 years i might try it again, but for now its nothing i want to play.

reviewText:
Review in prrogress:

Firefall is a genuinely free to play FPS or third person MMO shooter with RPS elements (and jetpacks) developed by a small dev studio called Red 5. In the couple of months I've been playing Firefall it has changed, and it has changed often mixing things up in what I suppose is an effort by Red5 to keep things fresh. If you have read a review from a month ago or before that then a lot of what is in that review is no longer relevant.

I've put a lot of hours into Firefall and I don't feel confident in reviewing it yet to the point of a conclusion. I'd recommend Firefall to anyone who enjoys first or third person shooters though because it isn't going to cost anything to try it - I've not felt any pressure to pay anything in Firefall.

What I will commit to say is that the design of Firefall is to me at least 'Merican in the extreme (think Duck Dynasty makes a game.) The bikes (one of the types of mounts you either unlock or pay for) handle like OCC choppers not real bikes at all and aren't remotely fun to use. On the other hand the views/vistas are some of the most staggering I've seen in a game world so it cuts both ways. That rather odd parallel sums up Firefall for me - utterly boring and disfunctional in some parts and a tour de force in others.

Firefall keeps getting better, and as long as it keeps doing that I'm going to press the 'yes' buttan.

No Linux support atm which blows heavily.

reviewText:
TL;DR and Pros and Cons at bottom.

Firefall is an interesting and diverse take on the FPSMMO genre of games, allowing a player to take on many different roles, and exploring team dynamics in a way very few other games have mastered. Each squad member will find themselves useful and needed at one point or another because of something that only they can do, and that's one of the things that makes Firefall a beautifully executed game. However, it's certainly not without it's faults. There are several instances where the game will become a long stretch of repetitive mission grinding, or thumping for resources. It can be excruciatingly annoying when you have to grind just to level up your character, doing missions that are essentially 'go here, press e, go there, kill these guys, etc.' The game does redeem itself however. Some of these missions you find at ARES job boards actually have fairly interesting stories and characters interwoven into them, making the repetitveness worth it. For example, a job at Sunken Harbor had me laughing quite a bit at a character known as the Meddler. Her personality was so over-the-top ridiculous, that it was hard to NOT love her. In addition to the job boards, the game builds upon the story through campaign missions which can be played at any time, so long as you meet the minimum level requirements. Some of these campaign missions will have you traveling into dangerous territory in order to save a crashed dropship pilot. Others will have you escorting a cart carrying broken equipment. Even more will pit you against seemingly endless waves of enemies as you desperately try to keep your foothold in their territory.

That's what makes Firefall beautiful. It's an incredible experience, and I highly recommend you jump into this enthralling universe.


TL;DR // PROS AND CONS:

Firefall is a very different take on the FPSMMO genre of games, and is well worth your time.

PROS:
Massive world
Great graphics
Plethora of random events
Diverse classes allowing for incredible team dynamics
Tons of weapons
Player-driven economy system via the in-game Marketplace
Otherwise, ridiculously fun
CONS:
Can be extremely grindy
Missions found on Job Boards tend to be repetitive
Somewhat steep learning curve
OVERALL RATING: 9.5/10

reviewText:
I was for the longest time looking for a game to play with my friends and with my wife.  and recently lost my job so looking for something free to play.    and most of my friends always played MMOs and we all use to love counter strike.   so I thought we should get 2 birds stoned at once and play firefall.

So far I am really enjoying the game getting both my MMO fix and my Shooter fix at the same time.

Things to note if you want to give the game a try.
~ The tutorial is lack luster and the game takes awhile to learn whats going on
~ I have so far never had anyone be rude to me in the game while asking newb questions
~ The game, Like most MMOs is fun with friends, i found myself a little bored when my friends logged out.
~ You might feel like the game is harder than it needs to be between level 8 and 15 if you didn't pick assault and are playing solo,   Keep in mind the Game is Free to play and if you pay for VIP (about the same Cost of pay-to-play for any MMO around  These problems are easily avoided.
~ You get a Mount IF  you log back in after your first hour session within 24-48 hours. but this bike isnt listed in your inventory unless you look at a small tab at the top right of your inventory.   So it took awhile to realize I had the item and playing without a mount in this game would drive you mad.


Overall I am really happy with it so far, I joined a clan and plan to continue playing it up to the end game content and see where that takes me.



If your going to play firefall I suggest
~Bring a friend
~Be willing to learn
^Sometimes Via google.
~Ask for help if you dont understand or cant find something. People are helpful in this game.

reviewText:
I had been playing Firefall for about 2 years in Closed and Open Beta before it came to Steam.  In that time a lot has changed.  I used to think the game was beautiful before I upgraded my video card.  Now I can't believe my eyes.  I used to like the fact that the playable world was big.  Now it's more than 4 times as big.  I used to get a kick out of going from missions to mining to dynamic world events to watchtower defense to full-scale invasions because I could play for hours on end without doing the same thing twice.  Now there is so much to do that I haven't even done it all.

With a single character you can trade out at any time between 16 different battleframes (basically different classes), focusing on whatever playstyle you choose at that moment.  If you're not sure what to do, then just go do anything; it all gives xp, it all gives loot, it all gives currency.  If you really have no idea, there are job boards in every town with a variety of short missions.  If you don't feel like doing anything in particular, just explore.  The scenery is gorgeous and varied, the music is incredible (I once spent several minutes sitting at the login screen just listening to a favorite track), and the community is generally talkative and quite helpful besides.

Mix all that in with a rich storyline from Orson Scott Card (Ender's Game), and you have a winner.  Also, there are 2 things I almost forgot to mention; first, every frame has jumpjets and access to gliders.  From a mobility/travel standpoint, this is pretty big.  Every time I go back to Borderlands, I find myself wishing I had a jetpack.  You really do miss it when you don't have it.  Second, this is the most Free-To-Play F2P game I have ever played.  99.9% of what's in the game can be obtained with in-game currency.  As for the other 0.1% (which mainly consists of the larger vehicles), it has been confirmed that most of it will be available for crafting with in-game currency in a future update.  You never have to spend a dime on this game to be competitive (or pretty).

All in all, this was my favorite game of the past couple years, and one of the best and best-looking MMO's that I've ever played.  Definitely worth your time.

reviewText:
I played this game back in Alpha and Beta.   To be completely honest i did not find it entertaining fully understanding that it was still being developed.  After a few months of some patches and fixes i got back into it, to see how things were.  It had got a little bit better.  I found myself with nothing to do, this was in early 2014.  So I waited practically a year now and decided to give it a whirl again.  I knew there had been many major updates and over hauls.

From then till now.

Then.  I couldnt play it.  Idea was great the game played great, but lacked content and drive.

Now.  I cant stop playing.  in the last two weeks just launching from steam i put in 80 hours and loving it.  Thats is not including the non steam hours i put into it.


Take backs.

Too many complaints about the crafting and resource system made them simplify things.   Major Bummer in my opinion.  The old crafting system was Very Complex and had a strong learning curve.  That particular feature was great.

Too many babies that didnt want to put in the effort made them simplify it.  8 year olds can craft now.

In the beginning there were loads of kids playing.  Im talking whiney, moany, suckin on the teets babies.  The Matureaty level for the players was UGH.  Not even joking.  Hated it.

But ill tell you what.  Since all the changes Us older folk have been able to appreciate the progress that this game has gone through.  It is very playable and entertaiing now.

All i can simply say is try it.  Its free to play, and if you dont like it you dont have to play it.  put in about 20 hours or so  get a feel for it.  Then make ur decision.

reviewText:
90 % of the negative comments are complaining about grinding and the game's getting boring in a while. And I want to address those 2 things.

Now I can't claim I've played it all, and I am sure there might be some pattern breakers out there, but every game has some form of grinding to it. How otherwise would you discern the players that have spent hundreds of hours playing from the ones that spent only a few. At least here in Firefall you can chose your grinding grounds as it isn't specified to a certain single mob you have to kill over or so. Anyway I dare you to think about most MMOs nowadays and then honestly claim they don't have some form of grinding, I dare you!

And about that game gets boring" thing. Those are players who never played co-op. Playing this co-op with friends over any form of voice chat is just awesome. The laughs and the giggles. Changing tactics and the way you approach things while you play is priceless.

Keep that in mind when you decide to play Firefall. And discard the trolls' opinions
date: because no game is ever good enough for them."

reviewText:
I was for the longest time looking for a game to play with my friends and with my wife.  and recently lost my job so looking for something free to play.    and most of my friends always played MMOs and we all use to love counter strike.   so I thought we should get 2 birds stoned at once and play firefall.

So far I am really enjoying the game getting both my MMO fix and my Shooter fix at the same time.

Things to note if you want to give the game a try.
~ The tutorial is lack luster and the game takes awhile to learn whats going on
~ I have so far never had anyone be rude to me in the game while asking newb questions
~ The game, Like most MMOs is fun with friends, i found myself a little bored when my friends logged out.
~ You might feel like the game is harder than it needs to be between level 8 and 15 if you didn't pick assault and are playing solo,   Keep in mind the Game is Free to play and if you pay for VIP (about the same Cost of pay-to-play for any MMO around  These problems are easily avoided.
~ You get a Mount IF  you log back in after your first hour session within 24-48 hours. but this bike isnt listed in your inventory unless you look at a small tab at the top right of your inventory.   So it took awhile to realize I had the item and playing without a mount in this game would drive you mad.


Overall I am really happy with it so far, I joined a clan and plan to continue playing it up to the end game content and see where that takes me.



If your going to play firefall I suggest
~Bring a friend
~Be willing to learn
^Sometimes Via google.
~Ask for help if you dont understand or cant find something. People are helpful in this game.

reviewText: So, you like Borderlands, but you also want to have a team of more than 4 players? Well, you can have all this and more! With a graphics style making small nudges towards the Borderlands series this game can be difficult to run at best, it needs some optimization. The devs also need to improve the quality for their server connections and UI to CHOOSE WHAT ZONE TO JOIN! Other than the key UI pieces that are missing, gameplay-wise this game is great, it can get tough if you get too close to an area that is too high level for your current Battleframe (Hmm, where is that other game about frames that are used for battle right now?) in all honesty as I play the game it becomes more and more addictive because of the fun elements that this game brings to MMOs in general.\n\nDue to the difficulty to get the game to run on less powerful PCs and the patchy server connections I’d give this game a 7/10.

reviewText:
I had been playing Firefall for about 2 years in Closed and Open Beta before it came to Steam.  In that time a lot has changed.  I used to think the game was beautiful before I upgraded my video card.  Now I can't believe my eyes.  I used to like the fact that the playable world was big.  Now it's more than 4 times as big.  I used to get a kick out of going from missions to mining to dynamic world events to watchtower defense to full-scale invasions because I could play for hours on end without doing the same thing twice.  Now there is so much to do that I haven't even done it all.

With a single character you can trade out at any time between 16 different battleframes (basically different classes), focusing on whatever playstyle you choose at that moment.  If you're not sure what to do, then just go do anything; it all gives xp, it all gives loot, it all gives currency.  If you really have no idea, there are job boards in every town with a variety of short missions.  If you don't feel like doing anything in particular, just explore.  The scenery is gorgeous and varied, the music is incredible (I once spent several minutes sitting at the login screen just listening to a favorite track), and the community is generally talkative and quite helpful besides.

Mix all that in with a rich storyline from Orson Scott Card (Ender's Game), and you have a winner.  Also, there are 2 things I almost forgot to mention; first, every frame has jumpjets and access to gliders.  From a mobility/travel standpoint, this is pretty big.  Every time I go back to Borderlands, I find myself wishing I had a jetpack.  You really do miss it when you don't have it.  Second, this is the most Free-To-Play F2P game I have ever played.  99.9% of what's in the game can be obtained with in-game currency.  As for the other 0.1% (which mainly consists of the larger vehicles), it has been confirmed that most of it will be available for crafting with in-game currency in a future update.  You never have to spend a dime on this game to be competitive (or pretty).

All in all, this was my favorite game of the past couple years, and one of the best and best-looking MMO's that I've ever played.  Definitely worth your time.

reviewText:
Keep in mind, that this game is a F2P, so don't try to compare it to the MMO heavies, like WoW.

Pro's:
- Legitimate F2P. Anything can be obtained through sufficient playtime.
- Combat is interesting. Generally solid, fun to engage.
- Community is great. Players are generally good people.
- Many playstyles available.

Con's:
- Still a lot of bugs.
- Mission diversity is very low. A lot of the same objectives with different voice actors.
- Enemy diversity is pretty low. End up fighting the same mechanics frequently.
- Gear is very limited.
- A lot of game mechanics are poorly explained, if at all.

I think the game was a lot of fun, getting my first frame to cap. The world events and mission lines were a lot of fun on my first playthrough. However, even with the XP boost, I just can't seem to muster the interest to go through it all again. The quest base isn't diverse enough to do anything but grind through the same dozen or so quests per area, and since random mobs are all but non-existent (and ridiculously low XP), you're all but forced to do them. Yes, there are random encounters, so to speak, but again, they are the same few events all the time.

There are only a few instances, which were pretty well done. Finding groups isn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be, given the relatively small player base. Running solo could usually be done as well, if you're decent.

Crafting was... unimpressive. I liked that it was fairly straightforward, and that I could craft most things in the game. The problem is the cost/benefit. Crafting is very, very expensive and time consuming on the front end, for relatively mediocre outputs. Given how easy most useful items are to obtain, versus how long it takes to get anything useful from crafting, it's basically not worth doing.

I think the game is worth playing through at least once. It did offer some things that most F2P don't, which I enjoyed. While it's not perfect, it's still a pretty good offering.

reviewText:
The game looks fun, on the surface.
Once you enter the world of Firefall, you'd think you'd never want to leave, right?
But once you realize that it's Pay To Win, it ruins it.
Who would want to pay for this crap, when you can just play Warframe, which is 100% better than Firefall, and offers better gameplay.

Parkour, many different classes, everything CAN be earned through the game, I have earned almost everything in the shop just by playing, and NOTHING is rental, unlike Firefall.

I suggest you avoid Firefall, and play Warframe.

The 1 star is for the vehicles, I liked that, despite it being rental.

reviewText:
The game provides you with a moderate open world to explore, but thats about it. (3 level restricted maps. 1 pvp zone and a handfull of mission maps)
Its extremely easy to level up. You can do it solo all the way to 40 or with a group, it doesnt matter. In the end it should take you no more than a week to hit 40.

Once you hit 40 you have a few options.
1. For every class you get to 40, you get to unlock one advanced class. In which you can get that one to level 40 and unlock another one.
2.You use your level 40 and do the same 2 end game missions with a small group and hope you get good items for your end game build
3. You can participate in some utterly broken PVP where people fly around and spam their AOE weapons and destroy the other classes with no AOE and cant hit fast moving targets.

When it comes to skills, you get to use only 4 plus an extra 2 that you can change out ones you dont like. And with an advanced class you can use the 6 from the basic default class, but thats about it. Not alot of variety.

This game lacks serious content for a game thats been around since 2012 and will end in extreme boredom for any serious gamer. Don't get me wrong. this game was fun for a little while, but it got boring fast.

reviewText:
Firefall is an amazing journey.  Graphically appealing, all the right FPS elements a decent job with gearing and skills and even has a pretty compelling meta-story.  But the harsh wash-rinse-repeat nature of the questing eventually wore me down and I could not bring myself to login.

MMO all suffer from the collect X from Y" model of questing.  Its the really good MMOs that make you forget you are doing that very thing that command a large client base.  Firefall is not very successful at this IMHO.  I eventually tired of logging in to do this everyday.

Come for the journey but be prepared for the destination."

reviewText:
I love this game. It's awesome. I started playing Fire Fall about 3 years ago. Like many people I was dissapointed iwith the direction it seemed to be taking. The crafting was impossibly difficult to understand, thumping was getting old, aand I decided to waiot until its official release to give it another shot.

There are some minor issues, but don't let these distract from the truly awesome game that Fire Fall now is. With the release to the public, this is not the end of the development. It is the beginning. Red 5 plans on continuously updating FireFall with new missions, new enemies, and a progressing story line that who knows where it will go.

The world is massive and growing. the gameplay is challenging and the Campaign missions keep you motivated to level up by completing jobs and Ares missions. While these may seem to some a bit repetitive, they are the tasks you complete to play the real meat of the gameplay which is the campaign missions.

The crafating has been revamped and although I am just now starting to explore that aspect of the game, I already like how it's implemented. It makes sense without having to google it, and the many battleframes available with their own unique weapons offer different ways to strategize.

NO PAY WALL. This isn't some freemium game meant to trick you into committing time into a game only to slam into a poorly implemented pay wall. There is NO pay wall. The stuff you buy is cosmetic, the abililty to upgrade faster will appeal to many, but for those not interested in spending a dime, you won't be committed to grinding endlessly to up your experience. there's some grinding but I find it quite well balanced and not a chore to complete but rather a nice way to really get to know the world.

Some minor issues are inconsistent quality of animation, some of the early missions are a bit annoying and overly simple, but once you get to about level 10, things really start o get interesting.

If you played this game before and gave up on it, you must really give it a try. This is not the game from beta testing, this is a seriously awesome game that I look forward to spending many hours  playing.

Excellent job Red 5!

I have approximately 99 hours logged in so far, and just hit level 21

reviewText:
I was a founder for this game because I wanted to play it so bad (and it was the only way to ensure becoming a Beta player).

It was a great game which had some of the best gameplay I've ever played in a mmo.

WAS.

tldr; I can't force myself to re-learn how this game is 'supposed' to be played every bloody year.

....

It's a game that I'd enjoy delving into for a week or two for 2-4 hours a days until I tired of what was currently available (or I had unlocked), set it down for a month, then have nostalgia for the fun gameplay and pick it back up again.

Eventually I had played enough that I had leveled up my favourite battleframe (the Raptor), and this was way back in the good old Beta.

Which was awesome, I had fun running around terrozing the wild life and finding some chosen spawn points (not really an incurision or invasion at that point).

It. Was. Fun.

They hinted at these new awesome battleframes (dubbed Tier 3")
date:
which I wanted so much. So far each frame had opened up a plethora of differing gamestyles and I was excited to see what the next level of specilization would bring (maybe a cloaking short range recon?) to the battleframes.

Eventually I got tired of waiting for these to come out so I took a break.

Time passes and I come back online to find that everything has changed; character progression

It's a game that I'd enjoy delving into for a week or two for 2-4 hours a days until I tired of what was currently available (or I had unlocked), set it down for a month, then have nostalgia for the fun gameplay and pick it back up again.

Eventually I had played enough that I had leveled up my favourite battleframe (the Raptor), and this was way back in the good old Beta.

Which was awesome, I had fun running around terrozing the wild life and finding some chosen spawn points (not really an incurision or invasion at that point).

It. Was. Fun.

They hinted at these new awesome battleframes (dubbed Tier 3")
date:
which I wanted so much. So far each frame had opened up a plethora of differing gamestyles and I was excited to see what the next level of specilization would bring (maybe a cloaking short range recon?) to the battleframes.

Eventually I got tired of waiting for these to come out so I took a break.

Time passes and I come back online to find that everything has changed; character progression

reviewText:
Alright you aren't going to like this review just to warn you.

This game friggin sucks, it might as well be called borderlands 3. It's everything I hate about mmos, no customization, grinding stupid quests(get me 10 rat skulls so I can make a flux capacitor.) No real indepth crafting.

Maybe I'm spoiled, maybe I'm used to sandbox games, but this game just doesn't do it for me. I didn't get a chance to try the pvp but that's because I was so bored by the time I figured out what I was doing I just stopped playing.

Boarderlands 3, thats it, play it if you like borderlands or facepaced shooters, but stay away from it if you are looking for an mmo to try.

I can't even compare it to an mmo really, it's an mmo in the sense borderlands had a baby with wow, but then it inherited none of the wow traits. I don't get why this game is even being made, it's just some rehashed mumbo jumbo with nothing new to spice things up. During my time playing I didn't find anything that made me stop and say cool". It's was like I was being tricked into playing because I was wearing a mech suit.

The voice acting is terrible as well.

I will try this game a bit more and perhaps change my review. But I am unimpressed thus far and it takes quite a bit of harddrive space up for what it is."

reviewText:
Is it buggy, yes.
But to their credit, thety do attempt to address bugs as they go.
Is it fun, yes.
Does the fun outweight the buggy, for once, yes it does.
Firefall is a PVE centered FPS/MMO hybrid in the vein of Tabula Rasa, with a rather helpful player group insofar.
If you are a PVP addict I have to warn you, there is no Ranked Play, PVP does not limit who can attack you, who you can attack, or how man can attck at once,  and you must opt into the PVP zone, so if you want to brag about your L33+ 5|<1LLz" you need to wait till you have  max leveled frame to join in that brand of "Fun" unless you want to feed the hungry

reviewText: I'd definitely have to reccomend this game. It's fun, single players can enjoy it just as well as group players. It has a very unique atmosphere and unique mobs to come across. It's a mix between borderlands 2 and an mmo. It sort of has a hit box along the lines of Neverwinter, except with battlesuits instead of magical powers. There are classes in the game that are akin to tank, dps, healer. You start off with one base class of each category and can pick which one you want to level first. If you want the tiered classes you can either purchase them or use a currency exchange. Interestingly, you have two options, you can either sub to the game or be a f2p member. As of yet, I don't see much difference except that V.I.P. members can enjoy exp buffs, and the ability to use a hang glider whenever you want - which  might sound silly but really cuts down on travel. The story was compelling enough and the landscape lush enough to just draw me right in.

reviewText:
Firefall is simply awesome. You've got multiple choices on how you want to play thanks to the different classes, each one having their own abilities that you can upgrade throughout the game, same for the weapons. A little bit like Borderlands, you'll find loot on enemies and quests, and you can customize your weapons even more with some modules, increasing some stats.
Everything feels responsive, and you can play either in a FPS view or a TPS one, or like I do, combine the two!
The game is graphically beautiful, even though Firefall is far from being the most optimized game, but they at least give us tons of options.
While there is some premium stuff, you can work and spend some time into the game, and even get yourself some free premium currency and get the stuff you want!
I'd strongly recommend to at least, check this game out, especially with your buddies.

reviewText:
Not recommended for returning players in all honesty, they screwed this game up beyond levels. New players however, wont know the difference obviously. Though they will have a fun time untill they hit the bugfall wall.

They completely changed the game. Not for the better. My rhino is pretty much useless now unless you enjoy aiming a boring laser beam within 30m. The movement system got nerfed the same way that warframe nerfed theirs. Much slower, and you now have to camp like a ♥♥♥♥♥ to surivive. The class that supposedly was a tank has now the most damage. And people are straight out blocking all your shots with their moving thunderdome. Oh, and ofcourse you got like 6 blocking thunderdomes, because everyone plays mammoth because its op.

The amount of bugs are unreal, and in all honesty some bugs should be fixed within no time. Not just annoying side bugs, but also alot of critical ones. Raiding? have fun trying to even get into the queue with you group, and if that works, there is a 80% chance someone dropped out. Forcing you to do it all over again just to be fair to that person.

As far as ive seen about 60% of the campaigns arent working, and the ones you can queue for are absolutely redicioulous. The bosses do no damage at all, while the adds can simply 3 shot you.

This game wont even remember your armor paint & decal. If you simply joined a raid you can customize it all over again. As alot have mentioned aswell, its all about tinkering now, and getting boosts. The tinker system has been used for so long in other games, i never thought red 5 would go down this road too.

With this update they took everyones items, promised us we would be compensated. All my frames were pretty much full gear. Now i only have 1 fully geared. Some people spent more time in farming items than me. Like for instance the lancer bike which takes a good amount of time to get, and its simply gone now.

Some people are still playing and claiming to be smart in making good investments or by kissing moderators butts. They just dont know yet its all for nothing and they will never get anything back. Its not even worth the time to get anything at this point since L45 and L50 patch will drop IN LIKE 6 MONTHS.

in all honesty its a update in progress, but i think they are already losing to many players. And there are posts from players that proof that the game is dying, with a current 800ish playerbase and dropping (which used to be over 2000). Well at this stage, it deserves to die.
voteText: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
So I have 40 hours into the game and so far it appears to be a good game. I love the crafting portion of the game and the refining of crude materials to be used as the base for more complex items. The server stability is not the best, but it is far from the worst also. This past week end it was impossible for a squad to stay together. The server chat, friends list, quest reward system and general NPC interaction was broken.  Today (Tuesday) the server keep rubber banding and dragging back to where i wAS 5 secs prior.

I like the reward for logging every day.  you getting bonuses for experience or gather of resources based on consecutive days of logging in and playing. Once you miss one day, it resets and you start building up again. The FPS feel of the game is right and the graphics are beautiful. The enemies are challanging and the gear earned as rewards are good enough to carry you through without crafting at all.

Travel is a bit challenging but even that is a sort of fun challenge in that you have to glide to your next location. It becomes a game within the game to make it without landing short. There are lots of regional events that spawn in that typically get all those int he area involved and the rewards are satisifying enough for you to stay involved in the next one you see pop up.

It is early but so far I think Red5 has a winning combo in FireFall. Overall score is 4 out of 5 Stars so far.

reviewText:
It was fun, once. And at the time I thought it just needed more content. But since then, with every new mission type they nerf an old one that used to be fun, make the progression system even more punishing. Hell, in the last update they REMOVED A CLASS from the game. Primary weapons used to have two fire modes, now they have one. The amount of enjoyable gameplay they have REMOVED from the game for NO REASON significantly outweighs any improvements the game has accumulated over the years.

And it just makes me feel betrayed. Why bother to play, they'll just reset your progression in the next patch? Why bother to unlock the frames, they'll just remove them. Why farm when the resources will be deleted? There's nothing this game can offer you, because all the devs do is take it away again and again to try to eke out just a little more money from their dwindling player base.

But now even the whales have left. Look at the gameplay stats. This is what happens when a game with so much promise is released into the world to be enjoyed, only for the devs to continuously change EVERYTHING without improving ANYTHING.

Maybe you'll have fun if you haven't played it before. But don't spend money on it. And for the love of god, if you have played Firefall in the past, DON'T COME BACK. It will just make you angry, and sad.

Edit: I know I've played more than Steam says I have. At least 60 hours, albeit most before the steam release.

reviewText:
It works, it's not bad - it's not amazing, but it's free.

Did a few quests, it's almost too easy. Feels like you have unlimited ammo and a shield that regenerates extremely fast. So far it feels like the only way you can die is from falling. The starting area will explain the playable classes and basic controls, so it's easy to get into as well.

reviewText:
500+ Hours invested into the Alpha/Beta/Pre-Steam releases.

+ Fun with friends.
- Feels like a slow monotonous grind without company.

+ Pay-to-Progress, not to-win.
- Have to grind for days to trade enough in-game currency for even the cheapest cash store items and boosts.

+ Multiple classes and varying abilities and play styles.
- A few of the secondary classes are exactly like their base classes apart from one or two abilities.

+ Dungeon instances are well paced, challenging, and very rewarding.
- The end game raid" content is lackluster.

The removal of PvP Arenas in beta was when I stopped supporting Firefall 100%
date:
those were the most fun out of all of the content being tested.

I give FIrefall a strong 3.5 out of 5 - in it's current state.

reviewText:
In short: Customize your frames, craft your own weapons and burn arachnas.
+ 10 points for jetpacks, controls are very intuitive and fun.

Been playing this for almost 3 years. Perfect for casual play.
There's some grind as in any game of this kind but the difference is FF's grind is not mindless.
The world is dynamic, events pop around all the time, there's always something to do and the devs are pumping more content regularly.

It has bugs, and the servers are wonky occasionally. A little bit of patience and /rui seems to be enough for most problems. There are some addons on curse and on the official forums.

The community is mostly mature and helpful. Don't hesitate to ask for help in /zone chat.
The Lore is very interesting, there's an official comic on FFs site.

I suggest this game to anyone who wants to enjoy some action in good company but can't invest too much time.

reviewText: Firefall has been through some rough times. I started playing in April 2012 and have seen the game change many times. Not every change has been one that people have liked, and months of progress have seemingly been tossed out at times. Not a few months ago I was of the mindset that Firefall was a dead game and nobody should bother playing it anymore. However, I don't feel that the game should be discounted yet, though. The launch patch will be Red5's final shot to show the world that their game is worth playing, and I feel that they might really pull through this time around with all of the things they've shown to the public so far. Launch looks to be the biggest and boldest update they've put out, from what they've shown in their Path to Launch" series of blog posts on their site. More than tripling the size of the playable game area
date: adding in craploads of new creatures to fight
hoursPlayed: going back to a leveling system
voteText: removing permanent breakage of items
helpfulPercent: and many other changes that people have wanted for awhile.\n\nGive the game another shot come launch! I've been pleasantly surprised so far
votesHelpful: and I'm sure I'll continue to be as I finally get to see what the game looks like at launch in the next few weeks. You may be surprised what you find

reviewText: I tried the game for like less than hour? and I was forced to quit afterwards due to a lot of annoying bugs and glitches. I liked it in a way that when you fix all the bugs and other problems its perfect for me! A huge MMO where you can interact with a lot of players, You can do quests together, you can climb rocks, use your jetpack from here to there. Its like borderlands with a twist of other games, but sadly problems are there to ruin it. I know its P2P but damn! its like its still in beta. Theres a lot of bugs like the main menu freezing picture, MAJOR AUDIO DESYNC. 2 background music playing at the same time, multiple NPC talking to you, etc. Also theres no character customization at the beginning? or am I supposed to do that later at the game? or was my game bugged out? Running the game in ultra high but still i get jagged edges, blurry textures, etc. Also I always get a lag spike and getting delayed actions in some ways, I don't know if its my internet or the server. Also, it would be greater if theres another server. Players are all crammed up in 1 server! You don't know anymore what will you do with the mission. I expected more from FireFall, considering its been in Beta for quite some time and I think a lot of players paid for the closed beta which should make the game better. Well I guess I should wait for a couple of days or weeks to get a better quality of the game.\n\nI would recommend it IF YOU ARE PATIENT with the updates, fix, etc. I guess for now thats the condition, but when all problems are fixed, well I would really recommend it to those who are fans of 1st/3rd person shooter, jetpack action, MMORPG, with a lot of weird stuff games!

reviewText:
First of all, if you are looking for a casual MMO to waste time on, GET OUT!

With that out of the way let's get started.  The game is a pleasent blend of Planetside, Borderlands, WoW, and a flight sim.

Graphics- The game's asthetics are pleasing to look at.  While nowhere near groundbreaking, the terrain looks nice and the people feel allive (as long as you can ignore the awkward animations). The many different places are all beautiful to look at and glide through.

Mechanics- The game machanics are what really sets this game apart from other MMOs.  The simple change to 1st person makes the combat so much faster and difficult.  While most games force you to learn what each move does in order to be good, this game makes you rely on your own skill to survive.

Story- What can I say? It's an MMO, so the story is a little convaluted.  A giant space thing hit the earth and made everyone sad. Then aliens came to Earth and made everyone dead.  You're their only hope...blah blah blah... A few interesting questlines, but nothing to brag about

Community- The community-from what I've seen-is very welcoming and friendly.  Sure there are one or two morons and jerks here and there, but overall it's a good community.  The economy is very, what's the word?... oh yes: unpredictable.  Realistic sure but frustrating too.

Overview- The game is very good.  I give it a 9/10.

reviewText:
Way burned out from MMOs but this one hits the right notes for the most part.

I prefer FPS view personally, but the game is playable both 3rd and 1st person.

After almost 11 hours of game play, I have a nearly-level 20 Assault frame.  First 10 levels goes quickly, like within the first 2 hours quickly, so the next 10 were surprisingly slow.

If you're big in to the RPG/Loot system of today's modern" massive gameplay titles (Borderlands
recommended: etc etc) you'll be very disappointed.  I've replaced my main weapon on my Assault frame twice.  At level 17 I was still using a level 6 weapon.  I've replaced my secondary four times

reviewText:
every played tribes? tribes2? enjoy the freedom of flight, being able to explore a large open world?  before i get all into about FireFall, will say this, not many games do i play for long periods of time, or even like the Devs behind most games..

----------------------
the simple: (like gundamn? voltron, silver hawks?) if you enjoy a open world, MMO, where you can earn everything in game just by playing and farming some, didnt say farming for yrs to get one item that you will out lvl soon, but everything in game you can earn...

if you enjoy guns, being able to fly, run around, jump off cliffs, drop posion nades that turn into clouds of green/blue smoke, devs who have events where they take control of the enemies and fight vs you? Customer service that dont make you feel stupid or like cattle? As in, Red 5 responds to us in the forums, they play with us in game, they give us rewards, everything can be earned, i cant say enough about certain aspects of this game, aspects that really make a game worth sticking around to play and seeing what new content comes out,

yep, new content comes out, new perks, weps, abilitys, warpaints for your battleframes, everything,,

this is how a gaming company should be, despite if they are BIG or small, just the interaction from red 5 with us in game and how they actually seem to care about its core players, this is how certain games should have been released (defiance) to name just one..

who dont want to fly around the world with a glider up high over mountains, oh you got tired of the glide? release from it and free fall, use your jetts and fly around, there is alot to do in FireFall, if you like to earn, farm, grind, group up, pve, oh and one of the biggest things for me about this game, since i was a GUI/video game skinner, i love to customize my character, this game is one of the best ever for that,,,

everyone starts with a male or female model, you can switch from male to female on the fly, but you can customize everything, from whats on your head, face, eyes, ears, mouth and my favorite thing, Warpaints,,

all you can buy with CREDS from the market, i have allmost everything nice and had them for awhile, working a full time job and just playing this game when i can.. nothing is out of reach, often you can find deals where ppl just want to move a item fast and boom, next thing you know, your BattleFrame is totally unique to you, never seen another one of me (Bimmie) in the game, one of the best things in this game by far..

sorry, tried to make it short..
----------------------
So, lets put it all out there about this game, FireFall MMO..
first, i have over 1300+hrs in games like defiance, played games like D2 & tribes/T2 for over 6+yrs straight, at first i thought this game was a rip off of defiance, but no, this game was in beta way before defiance was even thought of..

this is not a P2W game in anymeans, unlike a lot of F2p MMO's, you can fully earn and farm for every item in game or that you see in the red 5 store, which is extremely rare, i work full time, so i still find the time to earn my creds in this game..

creds can be used in the market or turned into red beans which then can buy stuff from Red 5's store, yea no trion worlds or defiance here, everything can be obtained..

game play: at first game was so, so for me, then i kept playing it for a few hours, once i got a few lvls and felt the speed of my battle frame pick up, i fully enjoyed the game, only thing i wish for is skiing like we had in the tribes series, but the speed of some of the frames, the freedom of open world and flight, you can craft your vehicles needed to travel around the world with..

game play of this game matches my more intense personality, especially once you unlock some of the perks and certain battleframe cores, like run speed core..

you have AOE, you have single target dmg, healing, pretty much everything you need to make a complete balanced team play event..

End game: there is plenty, but in my case, i dont care to JUST do end game content, i enjoy lvl'n a frame to 40, then you get 10 pilot tokens to unlock a new advanced frame with, or you can just buy the 99$ pack and get them all now, but once you get the hang of the game and how to lvl, it dont take that long to reach 40...

there is plenty of bosses to fight, you can use thumpers to mine with and gain your resources to craft with or sale your crafts on the market and yes things sale..

its not a stale game, plenty of ppl on daily...

Devs:  never have i played a game where the Devs take control of the enemies and fight us, they have special events which have been pretty much each weekend where they do this and they give out special rewards and unlocks for taking part of these events..

there is nothing shady about this company at this time, some ppl may complain, like they do in every game (league of legends) about balance, well, red 5 releases patches, they listen to us on the forums and for the most part they make changes according to what will benefit ppl, not just what they, the devs want,,

Hear that Trick dempsy & trion worlds? take note other game companies, even though red 5 may not be that big, they are doing alot of things right and they are not being greedy about it..

its that simple to me, i am happy to see a gaming company like this, get tired of other ones who treat us like we are nothing..

good job with this FREE, yes, F2p, NOT P2W MMO by Red 5... 20/10 will continue to support these guys..

reviewText: I find this game worth writing a review.  It's a solid MMO FPS.  It is quite honestly what you expect when you hear those terms combined.  It's not only playable, it's replayable and enjoyable.  It's absolutely not pay-to-win, and everything in the game can be acquired simply by investing time and energy - not cash.  It really doesn't even take too much time to get what you want with in-game credits, either.  Play the game, never spend a dime, and invest in unlocking all the cool stuff you want for your character.\n\nThe neat part is that all classes" are played from your one character - you swap your "Battleframe"

reviewText:
Overall, I enjoyed my time with FireFall. Don't let the time on my record fool you, I played this for a while before it released on Steam, so I have closer to 50 hours playing this game. Anyway, let's get into the pros and cons.

PROS:


- Combat is a lot of fun

- The jetpack makes this game differ from other games, with you using it more than any games I can name off the top of my head

- Playing co-op with friends and blasting through the Chosen is fun no matter what level you do it at

- Great customer service

- Their battleframe system is unique

- Even the so called medics" are very powerful

- This game is truely free to play
date: with every item in the game being craftable for free
recommended:
and without paying money

- The developers are very active in creating new events to change things up

-  Even though there are micropurchases
hoursPlayed:
you are not getting them shoved in your face every five minutes.

CONS:


- NPCs aren't memorable

- There is no quest log that you can use to abandon a quest

- Lack of a clear direction can be confusing to new players

- You have to grind a lot

- Crafting times and matierals are ridiculous


While it may look as if the game is bad
voteText: trust me it isn't. On paper it may not sound that good
helpfulPercent: but once you play the game
votesHelpful: it works. I definitely recommend getting this game
votesTotal: especially with it being free to play."

reviewText:
I don't understand how this game can have such a low metascore rating. That just goes to show you that you shouldn't always follow the majority.

This is the most fun i've had in a shooter in years. That's the keyword here... fun.

Yes, the game's buggy. There have been some awful immersion-ruining moments that I have personally experienced, a large number of times. However, the game has been behaving itself for the most part, and the issues i've run into have had some pretty easy to figure out workarounds.

Yes, the game is not beautiful. It looks like a slightly blockier version of Planetside 2 with some really downright weird looking character models at times.

Yes, the PvP is weird (that's the only word I can use to describe it)

Yes, the voice acting is corny. At the same time, it's really charming once you get used to it. The characters and their corny dialog/voice acting just sort of starts to grow on you.

But none of that mattered to me. The game was easy to follow. The mechanics were easy to learn. The classes, though not distinguishable at first glance, has a nice big icon over each player that shows you what they are. All of the game's flaws were overshadowed by the fact that I just had so much fun playing this game.

I don't like the thought that the Video game industry rates gems like this so poorly while continuing to give high marks to the usual shooter excrement that comes out every year and never changes the formula. Firefall is the ideal example of a game where users should ignore reviews and try it for themselves.
